searchDocs.title: Intro
searchDocs.content: Intro Welcome to the documentation for your Hide and Seek Roblox Template! First off, thank you for your purchase. It helps me to be motivated to create more game templates, and it helps fund, for example, purchasing maps and assets. Let's get started. The documentation will cover the following:​ Configuration of: GamemodesMapsSettings Monetization, including: Gamepasses (ex. 2x Wins, Faster Movement, etc.)Developer Products (ex. +5 Wins, +10 Wins, etc.) Much more will be covered in the future as updates come, this is just the base of what you can configure in V1.0.0 of your Hide and Seek Roblox Template. You will begin with configuration, chapter I being configuration of gamemodes.

searchDocs.title: Variable​
searchDocs.content: Seekers = 1,   Determines how many players will start in the round as a seeker  Example: Seekers = 1 → One random player becomes the Seeker Seekers = 3 → Three random players will become the Seeker

searchDocs.title: Callback​
searchDocs.content: OnPlayerAdded = function(Player: Player, Role: string) -- Example code here end,   Called when a player joins an active round

searchDocs.title: Parameters​
searchDocs.content: Player → The player who joined the active matchRole → "Seeker" or "Hider"

searchDocs.title: Usage​
searchDocs.content: The callback is used to apply gameplay effects, features, or more for a player when they join an ongoing match

searchDocs.title: Common Examples:​
searchDocs.content: Give a Seeker a special tool or weapon (ex. slap tool, as used in Slap gamemode)Give hiders a short speed boost or forcefieldApply role based abilitiesInsert GUI elementsCreate tracking values or statistics

searchDocs.title: Condition & Callback​
searchDocs.content: OnHit = function(Player: Player): boolean -- Example code here end,   Called when a player attempts to hit/tag/seek (done via main game configuration hit settings)

searchDocs.title: Parameters​
searchDocs.content: Player → The player who attempted to hit/tag/seek (done via main game configuration hit settings)

searchDocs.title: Must Return​
searchDocs.content: true → The hit is processed, further action is takenfalse → Halt further action, the hit isn't processed

searchDocs.title: Usage​
searchDocs.content: The condition is used to check whether or not a hit can be processed, allowing either further click action, or halting the current taskThe condition can also be used as a callback and condition, such as adding values or tracking an object (check Common Examples)

searchDocs.title: Common Examples:​
searchDocs.content: Adding hit statistics (ex. hidden leaderstats)Playing an animationDebouncing attacks (already done in pre-created gamemodes)Triggering visual or sounds effects

searchDocs.title: Callback​
searchDocs.content: OnTagged = function(Player: Player, Target: Player) -- Example code here end,   Called when a Seeker tags a Hider

searchDocs.title: Parameters​
searchDocs.content: Player → The player who tagged the target (aka. the Seeker)Target → The player who was tagged by the Seeker (aka. the Hider)

searchDocs.title: Usage​
searchDocs.content: The callback is used to apply an event to a Hider or Seeker when somebody is tagged

searchDocs.title: Common Examples:​
searchDocs.content: Classic (built-in gamemode)EliminationInfection (turn a Hider into a Seeker)

searchDocs.title: Condition​
searchDocs.content: RoundOverCondition = function(TotalActive: number, Hiders: number, Seekers: number): boolean -- Example code here end,   Called on information update to check if the round should be completed, or if it should be continued

searchDocs.title: Parameters​
searchDocs.content: TotalActive → The total amount of players active in an ongoing matchHiders → The total amount of hiders in an ongoing matchSeekers → The total amount of seekers in an ongoing match

searchDocs.title: Must Return​
searchDocs.content: true → The game is over, return everybody to the lobbyfalse → The round is still going, continue as normal

searchDocs.title: Usage​
searchDocs.content: The condition is used to check if the round should be completed, or if it should be continued

searchDocs.title: Common Examples:​
searchDocs.content: No hiders remain (Hiders <= 0, built into classic)Seekers outnumber hiders (Seekers >= Hiders)Only seekers remain (Seekers >= TotalActive, can be used for infection)
